text: In Norse mythology, Iðavöllr (Old Norse: Iðavǫllr — “splendour-plain”) is a location mentioned in the Völuspá (the first poem of the Poetic Edda); it is a field which lies somewhere in Asgard, home of the Æsir, and it is where the survivors of Ragnarök shall meet. Category:Norse mythology
title: Iðavöllr
